Soren,

This means that the requisite PHP PEAR DB libraries are not installed.  I
believe this can be fixed by using a newer version of PHP, though you can
as easily fix the problem by grabbing the libraries from crawl08.  If you
do that (as I did on crawl08) you'll need:

/0/apache/webgarden_docroot/DB/
/0/apache/webgarden_docroot/HTML/
/0/apache/webgarden_docroot/HTML_Common-1.2.1/
/0/apache/webgarden_docroot/HTML_Table-1.5/

And one other caviat.  To load the database you'll have to comment out the 
line '\connect - parkert' in crawlertesting.sql.  I missed this since it 
doesn't error out on my machine (or grab the working version from 
crawl08).  I'll get an updated version in CVS as soon as I get my laptop 
up and running again.

Thanks for giving it a go, please let me know if you hit any more 
speed bumps.  

pt.
-- 
Parker Thompson
The Internet Archive
510.541.0125

|I currently get the following error:

|directory in /usr/local/apache/htdocs/IATESTS/environment.php on line 9

|(include_path='.:/usr/local/lib/php') in
|/usr/local/apache/htdocs/IATESTS/environment.php on line 9

|All help is appreciated.
